segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and it's making me so angry.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe she hasn't noticed the water yet, it's so obvious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting more and more slippery as the water spreads, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm so frustrated that the children are going to slip and fall if they're not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is in the most danger, but he's too focused on the cookies to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just turn off the faucet already, it's so simple.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's dress is going to get soaked if she doesn't move, but she just stands there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't stand seeing this mess getting worse and worse, and no one doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, it's a shame the kitchen is in such chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to look away, but I can't help watching, even though it's making me angry.
segments.speaker: PAR
